docs.lead_paragraph: The Grand Central Palace seems more favorably situated for the purpose of attracting crowds to hear Mr. Moody than either Carnegie Hall or Cooper Union. Those who have seen the evangelist at great meetings in this city for twenty-two years say that they have not seen such gatherings of people since his revivals in 1876.

headline.main: CROWDS HEAR MR. MOODY; The Hall at Grand Central Palace Packed During Twelve Hours of Services Yesterday. PEOPLE WHO ASK FOR SIGNS Human Nature, He Says, Has Not Changed Since Men Followed Jesus to See Miracles or Get Free Bread in the Wilderness.
